Title:
A new species description of genus Gerhardtia (Lyophyllaceae,
Agaricales) from Japan on the basis of morphological and molecular
phylogenetic analyses and living cultural characteristics
Keywords:
anamorph, arthroconidia, Basidiomycota, ITS, LSU, 1 new
taxon
Abstract:
New species of Gerhardtia is described from Japan based on
the basidiomata morphology, living cultural characteristics, and
molecular phylogenetic analyses. This species is found on litter of
broad-leaved trees and characterized by a tricholomatoid to marasmioid
basidiomata, off-white to pale salmon pink pileus surface with faint
striae at margin, subdistant lamellae with lateral vein, tomentose to
strigose stipe base with hyphal strands generating arthroconidia
measuring 47 × 23 µm, cyanophilic, elongate-ellipsoid to cylindrical and
slightly verrucose or undulate basidiospores measuring 4.56 × 2.53 µm,
and cyanophilic basidia measuring 2535 × 56 µm containing siderophilous
granules. Phylogenetic analyses based on the internal transcribed spacer
(ITS) and large subunit (LSU) regions of the fungal nrDNA demonstrated
that the new species is related to G. sinensis and G. highlandensis but
differs from former species in color of basidiomata, shape of
basidiospores and habitat. An isotype specimen of G. highlandensis
showed rather close lamellae without veins and slightly larger
basidiospores measuring 4.56.5 × 2.53 µm. The new species is also
similar to G. marasmioides (=Clitopilus marasmioides) but distinct in
paler color of basidiomata. Cultured mycelium of the new species
produced arthroconidia measuring 4.58.5 × 2.53 µm with both schizolytic
and rhexolytic secession mode on MA and PDA media and chlamydospores
measuring 1024 × 6.511 µm sometimes covered with crystals on MA and MYG
media.
